post.description: Create a new subaccount under the account. You need an existing integration key that has been configured with the necessary API sys auth token in order to create a subaccount.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST \
  https://api.campaigner.com/account/v1/subaccount \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -d '{
    "companyName": "GBC",
    "title": "test title",
    "firstName": "first",
    "lastname": "last",
    "email": "test2@xyz.com",
    "phone": "6135551234",
    "fax": "6135554321",
    "timeZoneId": 901,
    "userName": "testname2",
    "password": "testpassword",
    "securityQuestionType": "BIRTH_CITY",
    "securityQuestionAnswer": "Brockville",
    "url": "http://google.ca",
    "disableGuiAccess": false,
    "address": {
        "line1": "123 here street",
        "line2": "Apr B",
        "city": "Anytown",
        "state": "ON",
        "zip": "H0EH0E",
        "country": "Canada"
    },
    "sendPasswordByEmail": false    
}'

post.description: Create more integration key(s) for the account. You need an existing integration key in order to create more keys.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST \
  https://api.campaigner.com/auth/v1/integration/key \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456' \
  -d '{
    "description": "Integration key for API calls",
    "isActive": true
  }'

400.description: Description is more than 4000 characters

post.description: Send a single SMS message to a mobile phone number. The message can be up to 4000 characters long.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST \
  https://api.campaigner.com/sms/v1/send/single \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456' \
  -d '{
    "mobilePhone": "19998887770",
    "messageContent": "Hey, there!",
    "shortenURLs": true,
    "customHeaders": [
      {
        "name": "custom header name",
        "value": "custom header value"
      }
    ],
    "includeUnsubscribeMessage": true
  }'

requestBody.description: JSON object containing the details of the SMS message to send.

400.description:
Invalid request due to several potential reasons:
- Account has SMS enabled but has not completed number set up
- Mobile Phone field is empty or not present or is invalid or more than 15 characters long
- Mobile Phone is out of account's sending region or globally blacklisted
- Content is empty or not present or invalid or more than 4000 characters or contains invalid characters
- Custom headers are invalid or name and/or value is not specified
- There are more than 5 custom headers or character length for name and/or value exceeds 255

401.description: Invalid integration key

403.description:
Unauthorized due to several potential reasons:
- Account is inactive
- Integration key is invalid or inactive
- Account does not have SMS enabled
- SMS volume sending limit and/or account credit limit has reached
- Subaccount is inactive or is not under the master account with integration key

500.description: Internal error while processing the request

post.description: Create a SMS campaign and returns the id of the created SMS campaign.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST \
  https://api.campaigner.com/sms/v1/campaign \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456' \
  -d '{
    "name": "SMS campaign name",
    "isWorkflowCampaign": false,
    "shortenURLs": false,
    "trackAllLinkClicks": false,
    "sendFrom": "sender 123",
    "includeUnsubscribeMessage": true,
    "contents": {
      "contentSourceType": "Campaign or Custom",
      "messageContent": "This is my SMS campaign.",
      "campaignId": 123
    },
    "deliveryNotificationEmailAddresses": [
      "email-1@example.com",
      "email-2@example.com"
    ]
  }'

requestBody.description: Create SMS campaign request body format.

400.description:
Invalid request due to several potential reasons:
- Campaign name that already exists on the requested account
- User supplies a campaign name having invalid characters
- User supplies a blank campaign name
- User supplies a campaign name having more than 255 characters
- Request has invalid value, blank value or no value specified for contentSourceType
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Custom and has no messageContent node specified
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Custom and messageContent node specified with invalid value
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Custom and messageContent node specified exceeding 4000 character limit
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Custom and messageContent node specified has invalid characters
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Custom and messageContent node specified has invalid merge fields
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Campaign and has no campaignId node specified
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Campaign and campaignId node specified with blank/null value
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Campaign and campaignId node specified with invalid value (not existing SMS campaign or not a SMS campaign or does not belong to this account)
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to campaign and campaignId node specified with a valid value BUT the campaign contents contain invalid value (as per existing content checks performed on the UI)
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to Campaign and campaignId node specified has valid value BUT the campaign contents have invalid merge fields
- If the API request has contents node specified, contentSourceType set to campaign and campaignId node specified with a valid value BUT the campaign contents contain invalid characters
- The API will validate the email addresses supplied for their format, and will respond with an error in case the email address(s) supplied are not in valid format
- API will respond with an error in case user provides more than 5 email addresses for delivery notification
- If the value supplied for sendFrom does not exist as a valid configured value for Sender Name for the account/API space for which this SMS campaign is being created
- If the API has a blank/null value specified for sendFrom field
- If the API request has contents node specified without null/blank value set for it, but has no contentSourceType node specified 
- If account is not enabled with workflows feature and API has isworkflowcampaign parameter set to true

put.description: All the contacts that are part of the the lists of recipients will be sent this SMS campaign.  The SMS campaign will be sent to all eligible contacts if sendToAllContacts is true.  The contacts that are part of the mailing lists in exclusionListIds will be exempted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the SMS campaign that you want to set the recipient to.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X PUT \
  https://api.campaigner.com/sms/v1/campaign/12345/recipients \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456' \
  -d '{
    "sendToAllContacts": false,
    "listIds": [
      12345,
      23456
    ],
    "exclusionListIds":[
      34567
    ]
  }'

- If supplied campaign doesn't belong to the account

- If any mailing list id is present in both listIds and exclusionListIds
- If any of the supplied mailing list id either in listIds or exclusionListIds doesn't belog to the account or it is static or it is not active

post.description: Download contact and/or campaign stats for my own account as a file from a SFTP location.  The export is performed asynchronously. The response contains a reference number that can  be used to check the status of the export.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST \
  https://api.campaigner.com/export/v1/contacts/sftp \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456' \
  -d '{
    "searchCriteriaXML": "<contactssearchcriteria><version major='3' minor='0' build='0' revision='0' /><set>Partial</set><evaluatedefault>True</evaluatedefault><testContactsOnly>False</testContactsOnly><group><filter><filtertype>EmailAction</filtertype><campaign><anycampaign /></campaign><action><status>Do</status><operator>ClickAnyLink</operator></action><operator>PastNDay</operator><value>7</value></filter><filter><relation>Or</relation><filtertype>EmailAction</filtertype><campaign><anycampaign /></campaign><action><status>Do</status><operator>Open</operator></action><operator>PastNDay</operator><value>7</value></filter></group></contactssearchcriteria>",
    "contactData": {
      "staticFields": [
        "firstName",
        "lastName",
        "email",
        "mobilePhone"
      ],
      "systemFields": [
        "emailStatus",
        "smsStatus"
      ],
      "customFieldIds": [
        12956877,
        49685777
      ],
      "returnListMembership": true,
      "returnCampaignData": false
    }
  }'

requestBody.description: JSON object describing which contacts to export and what information to export about them.

400.description: Model is missing required fields

401.description: Configuration is not found

403.description: Account is not active

500.description: Internal error while processing the request

get.description: Request to download information about all the groupings from an account, optionally filtered by their type as mailing list / static segment / dynamic segment or the category they belong.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter the groupings based on their type. if none is provided, all groupings are returned.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Filter the returned lists to items belonging to this specific category id.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of lists to return per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number of the data to return.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET \
  https://api.campaigner.com/lists/v1?type=MailingList&categoryId=1070&pageNumber=2&pageSize=10 \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456'

200.description: If valid input is provided then it returns data related to list

400.description:
Invalid request due to several potential reasons:
- Invalid page size
- Invalid page number
- Invalid category Ids requested; do not exist on account
- Invalid value for: type. Acceptable values are: MailingList, StaticSegment, DynamicSegment

get.description: Gets fields information such as system fields, static fields, custom fields, and mailing lists for a specific contact from my account

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Id of the contact to retrieve.

parameters.name: customFieldIds
parameters.description: Comma separated list of custom field ids (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any field ids that might be specified and will return all custom fields in the API response.

parameters.name: systemFields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of system field names (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any field names that might be specified and will return all system fields in the API response.

parameters.name: staticFields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of static field names (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any field names that might be specified and will return all static fields in the API response.

parameters.name: listIds
parameters.description: Comma separated list of list membership ids (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any ids that might be specified and will return a list of mailing list Ids and static segment Ids to which this contact is currently assigned to, in the API response

curl -X GET \

get.summary: Get all Contact Details with required values for an account (paginated)
get.description: Gets fields information such as system fields, static fields, custom fields, and mailing lists for all contacts from my account.

parameters.name: customFieldIds
parameters.description: Comma separated list of custom field ids (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any field ids that might be specified and will return all custom fields in the API response.

parameters.name: systemFields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of system field names (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any field names that might be specified and will return all system fields in the API response.

parameters.name: staticFields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of static field names (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any field names that might be specified and will return all static fields in the API response.

parameters.name: listIds
parameters.description: Comma separated list of list membership ids (or "all") to retrieve for contact. 'All' will take precedence over any ids that might be specified and will return a list of mailing list Ids and static segment Ids to which this contact is currently assigned to, in the API response

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of lists to return per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number of the data to return.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET \
  https://api.campaigner.com/contacts/v1?systemFields=All&staticFields=All&customFieldids=All&ListIds=All&pageNumber=2&pageSize=5 \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456'

  https://api.campaigner.com/email/v1/campaign/12345/recipients \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'IntegrationKey: YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
  -H 'X-Account-Id: 123456' \
  -d '{

Invalid request due to several potential reasons:
- If the API request with email campaign status is invalid

- If the API request has list id(s) specified are invalid
- If the API request has same mailing list or dynamic segment id is specified multiple times as a recipient in listIds node
- If the API request has same mailing list or dynamic segment id is specified in listIds node as well as in an exclusion list by exclusionListIds node
- If the API request has exclusion list id(s) specified are invalid
- If the API request has same mailing list or dynamic segment id is specified multiple times as an exclusion list
- If the API request has suppression list id(s) specified are invalid
- If the API request has same suppression list id is specified multiple times as an suppression list

categoryAssignmentStatus.description: Specify one of the below in order to either assign the email campaign to the category id in question (Assigned), or remove the email campaign from the category id in question (NotAssigned).

contentSourceType.description: Specify an existing source for the campaign content.  Depending upon your selection here, you may need to include additional parameters in order to provide more information.

templateId.description: If you specified Template' as the content source, here you must specify the id of the template in question. Content will  be copied from the specified template and used as the content for the new email campaign that will be created as a result  of this API call.

campaignId.description: If you specified 'Campaign' as the content source, here you must specify the id of the campaign in question. Content will  be copied from the specified campaign and used as the content for the new SMS campaign that will be created as a result of this API call.

fromURL.description: If you specified URL' as the content source, here you must specify the full URL. The HTML content found at the specified  URL will be copied and used as the content for the new email campaign that will be created as a result of this API call.

HTMLContent.description: If you specified Custom' as the content source, here you must specify the HTML content.

textContent.description: If you specified Custom' as the content source, here you must specify the Plain Text content.

generateTextContentFromHTML.description: Set to true if you want the Plain Text content of your campaign to be automatically generated based upon its HTML content.

subscriptionManagementFormId.description: The id of the Subscription Form that will be used for this campaign.Unless otherwise specified here, your account's Default Subscription Form will automatically be used for the campaign.

footerMessageId.description: The id of the Unsubscribe Message that will be used for this campaign.

signUpFormId.description: The id of the Sign Up Form that should be displayed when the 'Sign Up' button is clicked.

labelBefore.description: The text that will be displayed before the 'View Online' link.

viewOnlinePosition.description: The positioning of the 'View Online' link and its accompanying before & after textual elements: either 'Top' (this is the default) or 'Bottom'.

EmailCampaignGoogleAnalytics.description: Contains Google Analytics tracking parameter settings.

utmSource.description: The 'Utm_Source' parameter value. By default, this will be set to 'Email Marketing'.

utmCampaign.description: The 'Utm_Campaign' parameter value. By default, this will be set to the current name of the campaign.

utmContent.description: The 'Utm_Content' parameter value. By default, this will be set to blank.

utmMedium.description: The 'Utm_Medium' parameter value. By default, this will be set to 'HTML'.

categoryAssignments.description: Array of objects where each object advise the category Id (Comma Separated) to which this email campaign should be assigned to.

name.description: The campaign's name.  If no name is provided, a name will be automatically generated.

subject.example: Dream Big: Apply for Erica Davis Memorial Scholarship!

isWorkflowCampaign.description: Set to true if you intend to use this campaign as part of workflow.

fromName.description: The friendly 'From' that the email will come from.

fromEmailId.description: The id of the validated From Email to use for this campaign.

replyEmailId.description: The id of the validated From Email to use as the Reply-To Email for this campaign. When this parameter is omitted from the request, the specified From Email is automatically  used as the Reply-To Email.

autoreplyMessageId.description: The id of the Auto-Reply Message that will be automatically sent to  recipients who reply to this campaign.

trackReplies.description: Set to true if want all replies to the campaign to be tracked.

preHeader.description: This is the teaser content that will appear under the subject line when recipients view the email in their mail client of choice.
preHeader.example: Hi [Contact.First Name], enjoy a fun family long weekend with guilt-free Natural Top Dogs.

trackAllLinkClicks.description: Set to false if you do not want any link clicks for this campaign to be tracked.

trackConversions.description: Set to true if want to track conversions from link clicks in the campaign. Please note that the trackAllLinkClicks parameter must also be included and set to true in your request.

mailingAddress.description: Specify a mailing address here if you want a mailing address to be displayed in the campaign's footer.

enableCustomURLParameters.description: Set to true if you want to automatically include custom URL parameters to all links in the campaign.

customURLParametersSettings.description: Specify a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 5 comma-separated custom URL parameter key-value pairs.

enableAdobeAnalytics.description: Set to true if you want to enable Adobe Analytics tracking for the campaign.

encoding.description: Specify the character set that will instruct the recipient's email client or browser on how to display the  various characters in your email.

deliveryNotificationEmailAddresses.description: Specify up to 5 email addresses that will receive an email notification when this campaign is sent.

contactId.description: The id of the email campaign that was created as a result of this API call.

categoryId.description: The unique identifier for the category assignment.

categoryAssignmentStatus.description: Specify one of the below in order to either assign the email campaign to the category id in question (Assigned), or remove the email campaign from the category id in question (NotAssigned).

categoryAssignments.description: Array of objects where each object advise the category Id (Comma Separated) to which this email campaign should be assigned to.

name.description: The campaign's name.  If no name is provided, a name will be automatically generated.

subject.example: Dream Big: Apply for Erica Davis Memorial Scholarship!

isWorkflowCampaign.description: Set to true if you intend to use this campaign as part of workflow.

fromName.description: The friendly 'From' that the email will come from.

fromEmailId.description: The id of the validated From Email to use for this campaign.

replyEmailId.description: The id of the validated From Email to use as the Reply-To Email for this campaign. When this parameter is omitted from the request, the specified From Email is automatically  used as the Reply-To Email.

autoreplyMessageId.description: The id of the Auto-Reply Message that will be automatically sent to  recipients who reply to this campaign.

trackReplies.description: Set to true if want all replies to the campaign to be tracked.

preHeader.description: This is the teaser content that will appear under the subject line when recipients view the email in their mail client of choice.
preHeader.example: Hi [Contact.First Name], enjoy a fun family long weekend with guilt-free Natural Top Dogs.

trackAllLinkClicks.description: Set to false if you do not want any link clicks for this campaign to be tracked.

trackConversions.description: Set to true if want to track conversions from link clicks in the campaign. Please note that the trackAllLinkClicks parameter must also be included and set to true in your request.

mailingAddress.description: Specify a mailing address here if you want a mailing address to be displayed in the campaign's footer.

enableCustomURLParameters.description: Set to true if you want to automatically include custom URL parameters to all links in the campaign.

customURLParametersSettings.description: Specify a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 5 comma-separated custom URL parameter key-value pairs.

enableAdobeAnalytics.description: Set to true if you want to enable Adobe Analytics tracking for the campaign.

encoding.description: Specify the character set that will instruct the recipient's email client or browser on how to display the  various characters in your email.

deliveryNotificationEmailAddresses.description: Specify up to 5 email addresses that will receive an email notification when this campaign is sent.

sendToAllContacts.description: Set this to true to send the email campaign to all eligible contacts in the account. You can either include this node or the listIds node, but not both.

listIds.description: The list of mailing list ids and/or dynamic segment ids that you want to send the email campaign to.  You can either include this node or the sendToAllContacts node, but not both.

exclusionListIds.description: The list of mailing list ids and/or dynamic segment ids that you want to use as exclusion lists for the email campaign.  Any contacts included in the lists you specify here and that are also included in the recipient lists you specify in the  listIds parameter will not be sent a copy of the email campaign.

suppressionListIds.description: The list of suppression list ids that you want to use as exclusion lists for the email campaign. Contacts in suppression lists will not be sent a copy of the email campaign.

parentCategoryId.description: The id of the category's parent category. Will return NULL if the category is a root category.

pageSize.description: The number of categories user requested to return per page.

pageNumber.description: The current page number for which the data is being returned

totalRecords.description: The total number of categories that will be downloaded

totalPages.description: The total number of pages it will take to download information about all the categories based on the page_size given by user

categories.description: Array of category objects, where each object returns information about one category

textMessage.description: Text message of the MMS message that user wishes to send.
textMessage.example: Hello, this is my MMS message.

mediaType.description: Type of the media file that user wishes to include in the MMS message.

mediaURL.description: URL for the media file. The URL should be publicly accessible.

mediaContents.description: Advises the media part of the MMS message.

shortenURLs.description: Whether to shorten the urls in message content or not

includeUnsubscribeMessage.description: Whether to include unsubscribe message at the end of the content

includeBrandedMessageHeader.description: Whether to include branded message header at the beginning of the content. If the node is not present, then value set in account settings will be used to determine whether to include branded message header at the beginning of the content.

SingleMMSMessageSendResponse.description: Response model for SingleSms Message send.

XAccountId.name: X-Account-Id
XAccountId.description: Optional header that can be added if request is to be sent on behalf of an account id that is not the account id of the integration key.
